Objectives: To implement an integrated ERP system across all departments.
To improve operational efficiency through automation of core business processes.
To provide real-time reporting and analytics capabilities.
ProjectOverview.SummaryDescription: This project aims to implement an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) solution that integrates business processes including finance, HR, procurement, and logistics into a single system. The goal is to streamline operations, ensure data consistency, and enhance decision-making capabilities.

ProductScopeDescription: The scope includes the procurement, configuration, customization, and deployment of a comprehensive ERP solution. It covers business process analysis, software installation, data migration, user training, and post-deployment support.

Deliverables.description: Customized ERP system configured for core business functions

ScopeInclusions: Core ERP modules including Finance, HR, Procurement, and Logistics
ScopeExclusions: Support for third-party custom applications not compatible with the ERP
Development of custom modules outside the agreed scope

AcceptanceCriteria.criteria: Comprehensive mapping of current processes with proposed ERP workflows approved by process owners.
Successful system testing with at least 95% test cases passed and validated by stakeholders.
All key users trained and training attendance recorded for 100% of planned participants.
Successful system launch with no critical issues during the first week of operation and signed acceptance from project sponsor.

Assumptions.description: All departments will allocate necessary staff to support process analysis and testing.
Required infrastructure (servers, network) is in place before ERP installation begins.

Constraints.description: Project must be completed within the allocated budget and before the fiscal year end.
System downtime must be minimized and scheduled outside of working hours.
